messages.name: Canary
messages.description:
Canary configures rules to implement canary deployment. It belongs to the traffic scheduling domain.
The developer can deploy a canary version of microservice and accept coloring test its stability before
rolling out to the whole instances.

fields.name: canaryRules
fields.description: CanaryRules is the mesh service's all rules for canary deployment.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: CanaryRule
messages.description:
CanaryRule define the rule for canary deployment. Including service instances labels,
how to match colored traffic, which traffic is considered as coloring.

fields.name: serviceInstanceLabels
fields.description:
ServiceInstanceLabels configure the labels patched into the service instances.
Registry center will label it to corresponding instances during deployment. It's optional.
It indicates the canary target service instances. The relation between elements in this map is "OR".
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: headers
fields.description:
Headers configure HTTP requests matching configurations with "OR" relation. Once
HTTP requests match one element in this array, it will be regarded as the colored traffic.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: urls
fields.description: Urls describe the HTTP request matching schemes for this canary rule.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: CircuitBreaker
messages.description:
CircuitBreaker is used for blocking all in-coming requests when the the failure numbers
reach the configured limitation. You can declare an CircuitBreaker with COUNT_BASED or
TIME_BASED type.  It has three types of states, open, closed and half-close. One service
can declare its desired CircuitBreaker, and the upstream clients will active the same CircuitBreaker
locally when calling this service.

fields.name: policies
fields.description: Policies contain different breaker configurations for this CircuitBreaker to use.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: defaultPolicyRef
fields.description: DefaultPolicyRef is the default reference policy name.

fields.name: urls
fields.description: URLs describe the HTTP request matching schemes for this limiter to filter.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: CircuitBreakerPolicy
messages.description:
CircuitBreakerPolicy is the policy for describing Resilience component CircuitBreaker.
It contains the basic configurations for the breaker, including the type of sliding window this
breaker will use. Whether including network error or not and so on.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the identify of this policy.

fields.name: slidingWindowType
fields.description: SlidingWindowType is the sliding window type of this break, only "COUNT_BASED" or "TIME_BASED" allowed.

fields.name: failureRateThreshold
fields.description:
FailureRateThreshold configures the failure rate threshold in percentage. When the failure rate is equal
or greater than the threshold the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls.

fields.name: slowCallRateThreshold
fields.description:
SlowCallRateThreshold Configures a threshold in percentage. The CircuitBreaker considers a call as slow
when the call duration is greater than slowCallDurationThreshold When the percentage of slow calls is
equal or greater the threshold, the CircuitBreaker transitions to open and starts short-circuiting calls.

fields.name: countingNetworkError
fields.description: CountingNetworkError configures whether a network failure situation should active CircuitBreaker or not. .

fields.name: slidingWindowSize
fields.description:
SlidingWindowSize configures the size of the sliding window which is used to record the outcome of
calls when the CircuitBreaker is closed.

fields.name: permittedNumberOfCallsInHalfOpenState
fields.description:
PermittedNumberOfCallsInHalfOpenState configures the number of permitted calls when the CircuitBreaker
is half open.

fields.name: minimumNumberOfCalls
fields.description:
MinimumNumberOfCalls configures the minimum number of calls which are required (per sliding window period)
before the CircuitBreaker can calculate the error rate or slow call rate.  For example,
if minimumNumberOfCalls is 10, then at least 10 calls must be recorded, before the failure rate can be
calculated. If only 9 calls have been recorded the CircuitBreaker will not transition to open
even if all 9 calls have failed.

fields.name: slowCallDurationThreshold
fields.description:
SlowCallDurationThreshold configures the duration threshold above which calls are considered as slow
and increase the rate of slow calls.

fields.name: maxWaitDurationInHalfOpenState
fields.description:
MaxWaitDurationInHalfOpenState configures a maximum wait duration which controls the longest amount
of time a CircuitBreaker could stay in Half Open state, before it switches to open. Value 0 means
Circuit Breaker would wait infinitely in HalfOpen State until all permitted calls have been completed.

fields.name: waitDurationInOpenState
fields.description:
WaitDurationInOpenState configures the duration that the CircuitBreaker should wait before transitioning
from open to half-open,e.g.,60000ms.

fields.name: failureStatusCodes
fields.description: FailureStatusCodes is the array for HTTP failure status code for this CircuitBreakerPolicy.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: CustomResourceKind
messages.description: CustomResourceKind defines a custom resource kind

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the name of the custom resource kind

fields.name: jsonSchema
fields.description: JSONSchema is the json schema to validate a custom resource of this kind

messages.name: HTTPMatch
messages.description: HTTPMatch defines an individual route for HTTP traffic

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the name of the HTTP match

fields.name: methods
fields.description: Methods configures allowed HTTP method string, e.g. "GET","DELETE","POST"
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pathRegex
fields.description: PathRegex is a regular expression defining the route

messages.name: HTTPRouteGroup
messages.description: HTTPRouteGroup defines the spec of a HTTP route group

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the name for referencing a HTTPRouteGroup

fields.name: matches
fields.description: Matches is a list of HTTPMatch to match traffic
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: IdentityBindingSubject
messages.description: IdentityBindingSubject is a service which should be allowed access to the TrafficTarget

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Kind is the type of Subject to allow ingress (Service)

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the Subject, i.e. ServiceName

messages.name: Ingress
messages.description: Ingress is the spec of mesh ingress.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the identify of this ingress.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Rules is an array of ingress routing rules.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: IngressPath
messages.description: IngressPath is the path for a mesh ingress rule

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path is a regular expression for matching the target HTTP URL.

fields.name: rewriteTarget
fields.description:
RewriteTarget is a regular expression for rewriting original URL when
the HTTP URL path match the Path field.

fields.name: backend
fields.description: Backend is the mesh service's name.

messages.name: IngressRule
messages.description: IngressRule is the rule for mesh ingress.

fields.name: host
fields.description: Host is the RFC3986 defined host name.

fields.name: paths
fields.description: Paths is an array for mapping HTTP paths to mesh services.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: LoadBalance
messages.description: LoadBalance configures how to distribute the traffic inside this mesh.

fields.name: policy
fields.description:
Policy including four kinds of load balancing scheme, including random, weightedRandom,ipHash,
headerHash

fields.name: headerHashKey
fields.description: HeaderHashKey configures the key in HTTP header when the policy is headerHash.

messages.name: Mock
messages.description:
Mock is the spec of mocking service's HTTP responses. Once enabled,
this service won't need to be deployed, and other services visit it will get
the configured response directly.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enable configures this mesh service's mocking switch.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Rules are the array for this mocking service.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: MockRule
messages.description: MockRule is one rule for mocking service.

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path is the exactly path for matching request.

fields.name: pathPrefix
fields.description: PathPrefix is the prefix matching for request.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Code is the HTTP response code.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: Headers is the HTTP header fields for response.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: body
fields.description: Bosy is the HTTP response body.

fields.name: delay
fields.description: Delay is the waiting duration for HTTP reponse.

messages.name: Observability
messages.description: Observability consists of three components, outputServer, tracing, and metrics.

fields.name: outputServer
fields.description: OutputServer configures JavaAgent's tracing output target.

fields.name: tracings
fields.description: Tracings configures whether JavaAgent should deal with tracing HTTP header or not.

fields.name: metrics
fields.description: Metrics configures the metrics JavaAgent should collect.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enabled configures the global switch for this mesh service.

fields.name: access
fields.description: Access configures the access log about metrics.

fields.name: request
fields.description: Request configures this mesh service's HTTP APIs metrics.

fields.name: jdbcStatement
fields.description: JdbcStatement configures this mesh service's JDBC statement metrics.

fields.name: jdbcConnection
fields.description: JdbcConnection configures this mesh service's JDBC connection related metrics.

fields.name: rabbit
fields.description: Rabbit configures this mesh service's RabbitMQ requesting metrics.

fields.name: kafka
fields.description: Kafka configures this mesh service's Kafka requesting metrics.

fields.name: redis
fields.description: Redis configures this mesh service's redis requesting metrics.

fields.name: jvmGc
fields.description: JvmGc configures this mesh service's JVM GC related metrics.

fields.name: jvmMemory
fields.description: JvmMemory configures this mesh service's JVM memory usage related metrics.

fields.name: md5Dictionary
fields.description: Md5Dictionary configures this service's md5Dictionary for reporting complete SQL Sentence and signature.

messages.name: ObservabilityMetricsDetail
messages.description: ObservabilityMetricsDetail is the metrics detail of observability.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enabled configures the switch for one kind metric.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Interval configures the million seconds for metric reporting.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: Topic configures the metrics' reporting Kafka topic.

messages.name: ObservabilityOutputServer
messages.description: ObservabilityOutputServer configures how to report observability data to Kafka.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enabled configures whether reporting observability data to Kafka or not.

fields.name: bootstrapServer
fields.description: BootstrapServer configures the Kafka bootstrap servers.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout configures the timeout million second for requesting Kafka.

messages.name: ObservabilityTracings
messages.description: ObservabilityTracings configure the tracings of observability.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enable configures this mesh service's global tracing switch.

fields.name: sampleByQPS
fields.description:
SampleByQPS configures the QPS value for tracing sampling.
The exceeded request will be ignored.

fields.name: output
fields.description: Output configures the tracing output topic, queue and thread.

fields.name: request
fields.description: Request configures the tracing switch for this mesh service's HTTP APIs.

fields.name: remoteInvoke
fields.description: RemoteInvoke configures the tracing switch for this mesh service's HTTP RPC tracing.

fields.name: kafka
fields.description: Kafka configures the tracing switch for this mesh service's Kafka requesting.

fields.name: jdbc
fields.description: Jdbc configures the tracing switch for this mesh service's JDBC requesting.

fields.name: redis
fields.description: Redis configures the tracing switch for this mesh service's redis requesting.

fields.name: rabbit
fields.description: Rabbit configures the tracing switch for this mesh service's rabbitMQ requesting.

messages.name: ObservabilityTracingsDetail
messages.description: ObservabilityTracingsDetail

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enabled configures whether reporting this tracing component or not.

fields.name: servicePrefix
fields.description: ServicePrefix is used to be combined with the tracing component's.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enabled configures whether reporting to tracing output or not.

fields.name: reportThread
fields.description: ReportThread configures the thread number for JavaAgent's reporting process.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: Topic configures the Kafka topic for tracing output target.

fields.name: messageMaxBytes
fields.description: MessageMaxBytes configures the max bytes for one tracing report message.

fields.name: queuedMaxSpans
fields.description: QueuedMaxSpans configures the max spans number for reporting queued.

fields.name: queuedMaxSize
fields.description: QueuedMaxSize configures the max size of reporting queue.

fields.name: messageTimeout
fields.description: MessageTimeout configures the timeout for the message queue.

messages.name: RateLimiter
messages.description:
RateLimiter configures a limiter which can establish your services' high availability and reliability,
also it can be used for scaling APIs. RateLimiter can protect servers from overwhelm by the peak traffic.

fields.name: policies
fields.description: Policies contains different limiting configurations for this RateLimiter to use.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: defaultPolicyRef
fields.description: DefaultPolicyRef is the default reference policy name.

fields.name: urls
fields.description: Urls describe the HTTP request matching schemes for this limiter to filter.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: RateLimiterPolicy
messages.description:
RateLimiterPolicy configures the limiting policy used for Resilience component RateLimiter.
It contains the basic configurations for the limiter, including the permission number,
the duration for request waiting and the permission count refreshing period.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the identify of this policy.

fields.name: timeoutDuration
fields.description: TimeoutDuration is the duration for one request should wait for a permission,e.g.,500ms.

fields.name: limitRefreshPeriod
fields.description:
LimitRefreshPeriod is the period of a limit refresh. After each period the rate limiter sets
its permissions count back to the limitForPeriod value.

fields.name: limitForPeriod
fields.description: LimitForPeriod is the number of permissions available during one limit refresh period.

messages.name: Resilience
messages.description:
Resilience configures four key types of features, RateLimiter, CircuitBreaker,
Retryer and Timeout.

fields.name: rateLimiter
fields.description: RateLimiter configuration.

fields.name: circuitBreaker
fields.description: CircuitBreaker configuration.

fields.name: retryer
fields.description: Retryer configuration.

fields.name: timeLimiter
fields.description: TimeLimiter configuration

messages.name: Retryer
messages.description:
Retryer can perform an API calling retry when the service HTTP response code indicated its in
temporary unavailable states. The up-stream client should make sure this API is idempotent.
The service can declare an Retryer for its desired APIs and active in client side.

fields.name: policies
fields.description: Policies contain different retryer configurations for this Retryer to use.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: defaultPolicyRef
fields.description: DefaultPolicyRef is the default reference policy name.

fields.name: urls
fields.description: Urls describe the HTTP request matching schemes for this limiter to filter.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: RetryerPolicy
messages.description:
RetryerPolicy configures the policy for describing Resilience component Retryer.
It contains the basic configurations for the retryer, including the type of sliding window this
breaker will use. Whether including network error or not and so on.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the identify of this policy.

fields.name: maxAttempts
fields.description: MaxAttempts configures the maximum number of attempts. (including the initial call as the first attempt)

fields.name: waitDuration
fields.description: WaitDuration configures the based and fixed wait duration between retry attempts.

fields.name: backOffPolicy
fields.description: BackOffPolicy configures the two kinds of policy, random and exponential.

fields.name: randomizationFactor
fields.description: RandomizationFactor configures the factor used for backoff, value between 0 and 1.

fields.name: countingNetworkError
fields.description: CountingNetworkError configures whether a network failure situation should retry or not.

fields.name: failureStatusCodes
fields.description: FailureStatusCodes is the array for HTTP failure status code for this RetryPolicy.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Service
messages.description:
Service is the basic element in EaseMesh to describe a user's business microservices'
name, belonging tenant, and governance specs. One service should belongs to a dedicated
tenant.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the mesh service's name.

fields.name: registerTenant
fields.description: RegisterTenant is the tenant's name this service belongs to.

fields.name: resilience
fields.description: Resilience configuration, optional.

fields.name: canary
fields.description: Canary configuration, optional.

fields.name: loadBalance
fields.description: LoadBalance configuration, optional.

fields.name: sidecar
fields.description: Sidecar configuration, optional.

fields.name: observability
fields.description: Observability configuration, optional.

fields.name: mock
fields.description: Mock configuration, optional.

messages.name: ServiceInstance
messages.description: ServiceInstance is the runnable entity of a Mesh Service.

fields.name: registryName
fields.description: registryName is the name of registry.

fields.name: serviceName
fields.description: ServiceName is the name of service this instance belongs to.

fields.name: instanceID
fields.description: InstanceID is the identity of this instance.

fields.name: ip
fields.description: IP is this instance's address in EaseMesh.

fields.name: port
fields.description: Port is the port this instance listening to.

fields.name: registryTime
fields.description: RegistryTime is the time this instance registered.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: Labels is a map for storing service labels. This field is used for Canary Deployment.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status is the status of this mesh service instance.

messages.name: Sidecar
messages.description:
Sidecar configures the sidecar for every mesh service instances. It works inside the same
pod with the workload instance.

fields.name: discoveryType
fields.description:
DiscoveryType configures the type of service register/discovery type, its value are among
"eureka","consul", and "nacos".

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address is the registry center address for workload to visit.

fields.name: ingressPort
fields.description: IngressPort is the port for ingress traffic.

fields.name: ingressProtocol
fields.description: IngressProtocol is the protocol for ingress traffic. Its value is "http".

fields.name: egressPort
fields.description: EgressPort is the port for egress traffic.

fields.name: egressProtocol
fields.description: EgressProtocol is the protocol for egress traffic. Its value is "http"

messages.name: StringMatch
messages.description:
StringMatch configures how to match string in different ways.
Its priority is according to the field order. StringMatch will try exactly matching firstly,
then try to check has the same prefix, at last, it will use the regular expression to match the
string if it's provided

fields.name: exact
fields.description: Exact configures the exactly URL value to match.

fields.name: prefix
fields.description: Prefix configures the prefix for URL to match.

fields.name: regex
fields.description: Regex configures the regular expression for URL to match.

messages.name: Tenant
messages.description:
Tenant is the logic group of mesh services. Inside the same tenant,
services can visit each other directly. There are two kinds of tenant, one is the  common type
of tenants and the other is system reserved "global" tenant which's access scope is globally
inside the mesh . If one mesh service is created with "global" tenant filed, it can be visible
to all the service inside the mesh.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the identify of this tenant.

fields.name: services
fields.description: Services are the array of mesh service name in this tenant.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: description
fields.description: Descriptions for this tenant.

messages.name: TimeLimiter
messages.description:
Timeout configures the amount of time the client should wait for replies from a given service,
it will be running in upstream clients and declared in downstream relied services.

fields.name: defaultTimeoutDuration
fields.description: DefaultTimeoutDuration configures the default duration for timeout, e.g.,500ms.

fields.name: urls
fields.description: Urls describe the HTTP request matching schemes for this limiter to filter.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: TrafficTarget
messages.description: TrafficTarget is the specification of a TrafficTarget

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name is the name for referencing a TrafficTarget

fields.name: destination
fields.description: Destination is the service to allow ingress traffic

fields.name: sources
fields.description: Sources are the services to allow egress traffic
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Rules are the traffic rules to allow (HTTPRoutes)
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: TrafficTargetRule
messages.description: TrafficTargetRule is the TrafficSpec to allow for a TrafficTarget

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Kind is the kind of TrafficSpec to allow

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the TrafficSpec to use

fields.name: matches
fields.description: Matches is a list of TrafficSpec routes to allow traffic for
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: URLRule
messages.description: URLRule can be used to filter HTTP request by using HTTP method and URL.

fields.name: methods
fields.description: Methods configures allowed HTTP method string, e.g. "GET","DELETE","POST"
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: url
fields.description: Url configures how to match the HTTP request URL.

fields.name: policyRef
fields.description: PolicyRef configures which policy this URLRule references to.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
